How to Play: 
When the first round begins, players are dealt 3 cards. This number increments up to 13 cards in round 11.

The player who goes first draws a card from either the draw or discard pile.

Your objective is to make sets or runs from your hand.

A set is a group with 3 or more cards of the same rank.

A run is a group with 3 or more cards of incrementing ranks and same suit.

Whenever you have a set or run, select the cards and click add to group. To undo, select the cards and click remove from group.

You must discard each turn. Select the card you want to get rid of and click the discard button.

Once all of the cards in your hand except for one have been put into groups, click the go out button. This will give your opponent one last turn before ending the round.

Cards are associated with a certain point value, starting with 1 point for an ace and going up to 13 points for a king. Points for cards in your hand at the end of the round that are not a part of groups are added to your total score. The goal is to end each round with the lowest score possible. When you go out, 0 is added to your score for that round.

The player with the lowest score at the end of the 11 rounds wins. Good luck!
